sentences.sContent: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.sCn: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.sContent: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.sCn: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.sContent: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.sCn: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

remMethod.val: de(向下) + clin(倾斜， 斜坡) + e → 向下斜 → 消减

trans.tranOther: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something
a decrease in the quality, quantity, or importance of something
